Class ScoreBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • ScoreBar
  • public class ScoreBar
extends greenfoot.Actor
    A completely modular and reusable score bar with the color and text format losely based off the code by Jordan Cohen.

    Format
    The text should be formatted in a special way. Literal characters should be left as is, but anywhere where a variable will be placed, put two percentage signs (%) with the variable type, and format keys.
    Version:
    March 2017
    Author:
    Joey Ma

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addedToWorld​(greenfoot.World world)
      When the ScoreBar is added to the world and the width is 0, automagically set it to the width of the world.
      The string is then reformatted to fit the code's tastes, and the array is flooded by nulls.
      static java.lang.String doubleConvert​(double val, int dec, int leng)
      Convert a double to a string, but formatted with the number of decimal places specified, and as long as the length specified.
      Length takes precidence over decimals, so if the number has 15 places before the decimal and 4 after, dec is set to 4 and leng to 10, the string will only have 10 digits and no decimals, as if it were a string of an int.
      static java.lang.String stringLengthLimiter​(java.lang.String value, int digits)
      POWER LEVEL LIMITER.
      <E> void update​(int pos, E element)
      Set the element at a position to a different element.
      (Named update instead of set because I put way too many updates in the world and I don't feel like ctrl+f-ing for them)
      (IF YOU ARE PUTTING A DOUBLE PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF OUR LORD AND SAVIOUR JESUS CHRIST DO NOT PUT A INTEGER LIKE 4 PLEASE PUT 4.0 OR A DOUBLE)
      void updateText()
      Update the text the scorebar is displaying with the variables regardless of whether or not the variables have been updated, just for safety.
      static java.lang.String zeroAdder​(int value, int digits)
      Method that aids in the appearance of the scoreboard by generating Strings that fill in zeros before the score.

      • ScoreBar

        public ScoreBar​(int width,
                java.lang.String format)
        Construct a ScoreBar object with the set width and format. If width is set to 0, the ScoreBar will automatically grab the size of the world as it's width.
        Parameters:
        width - A single integer for the width of the scoreboard
        format - a single string for the format of the scoreboard
        See Also:
        format

                java.lang.String format,
                greenfoot.Color text,
                greenfoot.Color bg)
        Construct a ScoreBar with set width, format, text color and background color. If width is set to 0, the ScoreBar will automatically grab the size of the world as it's width.
        Parameters:
        width - A single integer for the width of the scoreboard
        format - a single string for the format of the scoreboard
        text - color of the text
        bg - color of the background
        See Also:

      • addedToWorld

        public void addedToWorld​(greenfoot.World world)
        When the ScoreBar is added to the world and the width is 0, automagically set it to the width of the world.
        The string is then reformatted to fit the code's tastes, and the array is flooded by nulls.

      • update

        public <E> void update​(int pos,
                       E element)
        Set the element at a position to a different element.
        (Named update instead of set because I put way too many updates in the world and I don't feel like ctrl+f-ing for them)
        (IF YOU ARE PUTTING A DOUBLE PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF OUR LORD AND SAVIOUR JESUS CHRIST DO NOT PUT A INTEGER LIKE 4 PLEASE PUT 4.0 OR A DOUBLE)
        Parameters:
        pos - the index (0-based) of the element to be updated
        element - the element to replace the old with

      • updateText

        public void updateText()
        Update the text the scorebar is displaying with the variables regardless of whether or not the variables have been updated, just for safety.

      • doubleConvert

        public static java.lang.String doubleConvert​(double val,
                                             int dec,
                                             int leng)
        Convert a double to a string, but formatted with the number of decimal places specified, and as long as the length specified.
        Length takes precidence over decimals, so if the number has 15 places before the decimal and 4 after, dec is set to 4 and leng to 10, the string will only have 10 digits and no decimals, as if it were a string of an int.
        Parameters:
        val - the double to be converted
        dec - the number of decimal places to truncate to (no rounding)
        leng - the number of digits (the . is not a digit)
        Returns:
        String formatted decimal as a String

      • stringLengthLimiter

        public static java.lang.String stringLengthLimiter​(java.lang.String value,
                                                   int digits)
        POWER LEVEL LIMITER. Limit the length of a string starting from the right. DOES NOT ADD CHARACTERS.

      • zeroAdder

        public static java.lang.String zeroAdder​(int value,
                                         int digits)
        Method that aids in the appearance of the scoreboard by generating Strings that fill in zeros before the score. For example: 27 ===> to 5 digits ===> 00027 Ripped from Mr. Cohen
        Parameters:
        value - integer value to use for score output
        digits - number of zeros desired in the return String
        Returns:
        String built score, ready for display
